EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting at position (0.0, 0.0):
 – Stone Furnace (position 0.0, 0.0) with fuel {'coal': 1}, inventory {'iron-plate': 9} and status NO_INGREDIENTS.
 – Burner Inserter (position 1.5, 0.5).
• Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at position (5.0, 0.0):
 – Stone Furnace (position 5.0, 0.0) with fuel {'coal': 4}.
 – Burner Inserter (position 3.5, 0.5).
• Common Input Chest:
 – Wooden Chest (position 2.5, 0.5) holding inventory {'copper-plate': 5}.
• New Feeder Inserter:
 – Feeder Inserter (position 2.5, -0.5) with pickup at (2.5, -1.5) and drop at (2.5, 0.5); warning: ['out of fuel'].

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup at position (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill (position -15.0, -50.0) for ore extraction with drop at (-14.5, -48.5) and status NO_FUEL.
• Drill Inserter (position -13.5, -47.5) with drop at (-14.5, -47.5) and warning ['out of fuel'].
 – An intended transport belt link from this setup to the feeder inserter at (2.5, -0.5) remains unestablished due to an inventory shortage of transport belts.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Incorrect Entity Removal Invocation:
 – When removing feeder inserters, ensure that if the first argument is an Entity object, the second argument is passed as None to avoid parameter mismatches.

• Transport Belt Connection and Crafting Sub-ingredient Shortages:
 – Verify that adequate transport belts are available (e.g. a requirement of 64 units) before attempting to connect the drill inserter to the feeder inserter.
 – Ensure that all precursor items (iron-plates and iron-gear-wheels) are sufficiently produced or available; repeated crafting failures indicate missing sub-ingredient chains.

• Resource Extraction and Fuel Insertion Issues:
 – Confirm that a furnace contains the expected output before extraction to avoid targeting an empty or incorrect entity.
 – Validate that required inventory items (such as coal for fuel insertion) are present prior to initiating insertion operations.

• Maintain Placement and API Handling Best Practices:
 – Always verify that target tiles are unoccupied prior to placement.
 – Use proper entity prototypes and correct parameter types when calling API functions to prevent alignment and type-related errors.

NAMESPACE
─────────
shift_entity_local(entity: Entity, offset: Tuple[float, float]) -> Entity
 • Shifts the given entity’s position locally by the specified offset.
  – Invocation: Defined successfully to resolve previous shift_entity errors.

Important Variables:
• furnace_input_chest_pos (Position) – holds the position of the furnace’s input chest.
• current_player_inventory (Inventory) – tracks the current state of the player’s inventory.
